connector.description: Expose gRPC endpoints and access external gRPC endpoints.

camel.sink.path.host.name: camel.sink.path.host
camel.sink.path.host.description: The gRPC server host name. This is localhost or 0.0.0.0 when being a consumer or remote server host name when using producer.

camel.sink.path.port.name: camel.sink.path.port
camel.sink.path.port.description: The gRPC local or remote server port

camel.sink.path.service.name: camel.sink.path.service
camel.sink.path.service.description: Fully qualified service name from the protocol buffer descriptor file (package dot service definition name)

camel.sink.endpoint.autoDiscoverClientIn.name: camel.sink.endpoint.autoDiscoverClientInterceptors
camel.sink.endpoint.autoDiscoverClientIn.description: Setting the autoDiscoverClientInterceptors mechanism, if true, the component will look for a ClientInterceptor instance in the registry automatically otherwise it will skip that checking.

camel.sink.endpoint.flowControlWindow.name: camel.sink.endpoint.flowControlWindow
camel.sink.endpoint.flowControlWindow.description: The HTTP/2 flow control window size (MiB)

camel.sink.endpoint.maxMessageSize.name: camel.sink.endpoint.maxMessageSize
camel.sink.endpoint.maxMessageSize.description: The maximum message size allowed to be received/sent (MiB)

camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer
camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.sink.endpoint.producerStrategy.name: camel.sink.endpoint.producerStrategy
camel.sink.endpoint.producerStrategy.description: The mode used to communicate with a remote gRPC server. In SIMPLE mode a single exchange is translated into a remote procedure call. In STREAMING mode all exchanges will be sent within the same request (input and output of the recipient gRPC service must be of type 'stream'). One of: [SIMPLE] [STREAMING]

camel.sink.endpoint.streamRepliesTo.name: camel.sink.endpoint.streamRepliesTo
camel.sink.endpoint.streamRepliesTo.description: When using STREAMING client mode, it indicates the endpoint where responses should be forwarded.

camel.sink.endpoint.userAgent.name: camel.sink.endpoint.userAgent
camel.sink.endpoint.userAgent.description: The user agent header passed to the server

camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous.name: camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous
camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used

camel.sink.endpoint.authenticationType.name: camel.sink.endpoint.authenticationType
camel.sink.endpoint.authenticationType.description: Authentication method type in advance to the SSL/TLS negotiation One of: [NONE] [GOOGLE] [JWT]

camel.sink.endpoint.jwtAlgorithm.name: camel.sink.endpoint.jwtAlgorithm
camel.sink.endpoint.jwtAlgorithm.description: JSON Web Token sign algorithm One of: [HMAC256] [HMAC384] [HMAC512]

camel.sink.endpoint.keyCertChainResource.name: camel.sink.endpoint.keyCertChainResource
camel.sink.endpoint.keyCertChainResource.description: The X.509 certificate chain file resource in PEM format link

camel.sink.endpoint.keyPassword.name: camel.sink.endpoint.keyPassword
camel.sink.endpoint.keyPassword.description: The PKCS#8 private key file password

camel.sink.endpoint.keyResource.name: camel.sink.endpoint.keyResource
camel.sink.endpoint.keyResource.description: The PKCS#8 private key file resource in PEM format link

camel.sink.endpoint.negotiationType.name: camel.sink.endpoint.negotiationType
camel.sink.endpoint.negotiationType.description: Identifies the security negotiation type used for HTTP/2 communication One of: [TLS] [PLAINTEXT_UPGRADE] [PLAINTEXT]

camel.sink.endpoint.serviceAccountResour.name: camel.sink.endpoint.serviceAccountResource
camel.sink.endpoint.serviceAccountResour.description: Service Account key file in JSON format resource link supported by the Google Cloud SDK

camel.sink.endpoint.trustCertCollectionR.name: camel.sink.endpoint.trustCertCollectionResource
camel.sink.endpoint.trustCertCollectionR.description: The trusted certificates collection file resource in PEM format for verifying the remote endpoint's certificate

camel.component.grpc.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.component.grpc.lazyStartProducer
camel.component.grpc.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.component.grpc.autowiredEnabled.name: camel.component.grpc.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.grpc.autowiredEnabled.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.
